reviews.text: Quite little campus out in the middle of nowhere, the building are pretty spaced out. Otherwise awesome staff and very helpful and organized teachers
Due to special circumstances, I registered for  MCC less than two weeks before classes started and was able to get into the Honors Program. The staff was very helpful. Also, they have a nice campus.
Small community and small classes
An absolutely beautiful campus!

Amazing teachers and campus!!!! Teachers go out of their way to help you. Advising staff helps a ton. Free tutoring is awesome. I graduated from MCC and this is my preferred campus hands down!! A TON better environment then the Dobson campus

A quiet place. A place where your heart can go to receive rest. I'm very grateful for the purpose of the Temple. I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints. The biblical purpose of the Temple is a symbolic of the Temple Christ walked through and worked in. The pattern of Temple work is also performed in our day by worthy members who uphold sacred promises to the Lord through covenant keeping. Such as being honest, true, chaste, benevolent and in doing good to all man. Keeping ourselves clean from the blood and stains of this generation. Such as impure thoughts, addiction to pornography, unhealthy living habits like drinking beer or smoking, paying an honest fast and tithes. Attending sacrament and other church meetings. Being faithful to God. Repenting when a mistake has been made. Living daily for the sole purpose of defending the kingdom of God. Sharing the truthfulness of gospel principles and God's blessings. Helping others to know of their value and worth. That God's always there for them and wants them to be with him forever.

Beautiful inside and out. From a worldly perspective, great place to take professional photos and wonderful during the Christmas season with how many lights; makes an easy no cost date during that time with the lights and nightly entertainment. From a spiritual perspective, there are few places in the world that can get you as close to God as this place can.

We love this temple and have many fond memories over the years. Since the temple is currently closed for major renovation to the temple, adjacent facilities, and surrounding grounds, we drive by occasionally to see the progress. We are very excited about the new "Discovery Center" that is being built across the street. Until the remodel is complete, we will continue to visit the Gilbert Temple.
The temple is a beautiful place to visit at any time; although it is under construction currently.
Wonderful place to visit to feel calm and peaceful! The missionaries here are incredibly kind, welcoming and friendly!

Great place for families to come. The kids really enjoyed it. The jail cells and the dinosaurs  are a little loud so if you have a sound sensitive you might want to avoid that area of tell the child in advance.  Panning for gold was fun.

There's a lot to do here! Museum is clean, easy to navigate, and the exhibits are set up great. On some exhibits, I wish there was more information. There was only one exhibit that wasn't great and it was more because its location (it seemed to be in the middle of a major walking path). Otherwise a very enjoyable experience.

Went on a daddy daughter date here, and for the most part had fun until the end where the children's slide is,  well someone thought it would be a good idea to Attach a 2 × 4 at the bottom of the slide to were my daughter  Got injured not once but twice hitting her tailbone on that 2 × 4,  Also in that same area looked to be another exhibit of some sort which was currently under construction and there were no  Barricades or anything to keep children or anybody out of that area. Consequently there were children playing there, and no employees were around to address the safety concern.  Over all it was a good experience, before we would return These safety concerns need to be addressed.
Fun way to spend the afternoon.  Admission is very reasonable and the price at the gift shop were great.  I loved looking at all the dinosaurs

So fun! We went with my 3 year old and my friend's 2 year old and they had a blast! So many interactive stations for the toddlers and so much to see. It was pretty loud because we happened to go when a large field trip was there. Also, stroller friendly but it can get kinda annoying to have to go find the elevator when wanting to go up and down the levels.
Always a spectacle to see so many things to admire here from the past of American Aviation

Difficult to find and when we did find it, it was closed.  Sign on the door said the lost tear least and will reopen in March.  It would be very helpful if someone would update their website.  It is clearly out of the way at the Brownsville Airport.  Not very well marked.
Beautiful vintage aircraft! It’s a shame that they will be leaving somewhere else in January 2018. Recommend this to the history lovers!
When we got here it was really hard to find due to it not being in drive view ,we got here and said it was closed for two months. Wish thay had mentioned that on there site

The volunteer there have me, my wife and our 6 year old grandson what amounted to a private tour. Somewhat disappointed in the types of aircraft on display but the volunteer made up for that. He even let grandson sit in his personal plane
Cost effective, easy walk around outdoor museum of the historic Mesa grand from approx 600ad - 1300ad
Nothing to see but over grown plants
Ancient ruins in a small community. What more can you ask for to teach your kids about life!?

I went on a frield trip there. It was a small place but the people who worked there were very nice and gave quite a bit of information about the Hohokam people even though there was mostly a lot of mortar slabs ( if that's what you call them) there.  There's a mound on top that used to be 27 ft high & the size if a football field , not much left to look at. Still kept my intetest. Only spent about a hour there.
Fun field trip with lots of interesting facts.

A quiet place. A place where your heart can go to receive rest. I'm very grateful for the purpose of the Temple. I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints. The biblical purpose of the Temple is a symbolic of the Temple Christ walked through and worked in. The pattern of Temple work is also performed in our day by worthy members who uphold sacred promises to the Lord through covenant keeping. Such as being honest, true, chaste, benevolent and in doing good to all man. Keeping ourselves clean from the blood and stains of this generation. Such as impure thoughts, addiction to pornography, unhealthy living habits like drinking beer or smoking, paying an honest fast and tithes. Attending sacrament and other church meetings. Being faithful to God. Repenting when a mistake has been made. Living daily for the sole purpose of defending the kingdom of God. Sharing the truthfulness of gospel principles and God's blessings. Helping others to know of their value and worth. That God's always there for them and wants them to be with him forever.

Beautiful inside and out. From a worldly perspective, great place to take professional photos and wonderful during the Christmas season with how many lights; makes an easy no cost date during that time with the lights and nightly entertainment. From a spiritual perspective, there are few places in the world that can get you as close to God as this place can.

We love this temple and have many fond memories over the years. Since the temple is currently closed for major renovation to the temple, adjacent facilities, and surrounding grounds, we drive by occasionally to see the progress. We are very excited about the new "Discovery Center" that is being built across the street. Until the remodel is complete, we will continue to visit the Gilbert Temple.
The temple is a beautiful place to visit at any time; although it is under construction currently.
Wonderful place to visit to feel calm and peaceful! The missionaries here are incredibly kind, welcoming and friendly!

The place was nice and clean. The gentleman behind the counter was handling the long line well. Actually he was excellent and made recommendations to my mom who is a little chicken when it comes to spicy food. He quickly explained the flavors and she still passed (bock bock) but it was great that he did that! Will definitely come back soon

Best smothered shredded pork burritos in Gilbert! 

This place has excellent and great tasting smothered burritos. Each time I come here (which is 3 to 4 times a year) I always order the same thing,  smothered shredded pork burrito. 

Food: Always fresh and always flavorful! They make fresh flour tortillas right there in front of you. Never old or stale food. They are always busy which is great because they quickly rotate their food with new fresh food. 

Menu: They have a great size menu and I love the fact that they have lots of pictures of their menu. I hate reading a menu but not being able to see pictures of what the food looks like. 

Service: never any problems with the staff. They hire young people that are fast at making your food to help keep the wait time down. 

Great place if you want really big portions to feed large groups or a family! I'm 6'1 and 205 pounds. One burrito over-fills me up.
Food was good. Nutritional content is the only reason for 3 stars. No complaints. Staff was nice. Facility was clean. I’d go back on a cheat day
This place is always good! Even if they are busy you don't have to be afraid of getting something to eat here. The food is quick and always delicious

Costa Vida can be hit and miss. Order most anything on the menu and its decent and tasty. Sweet pork salad seems to be the only thing that really wows me. I won't say no if a friend wants to eat there but it's never my 1st choice.

It is a long standing staple of mesa. Good food. Great onion rings. Uncomfortable seating though. Always has been. Very dirty. And they won't accept plastic. Very inconvenient considering so many people hate carrying cash these days. They could get with the times a bit more in my opinion but maybe they just think they been around long enough that making it easy for customers to visit them does not matter. Personally I have gotten all the way here on more than one occasion only to femember they only deal in cash & have gone elsewhere due to this fact.
Lovely meal even if it was just a quick bite. The lot was filled with people but they can accommodate everyone fast. Great food and service! Thank you

I've always loved Pete's! I hadn't eaten there in many years. But that good familiar great tasting food brought back many good memories for me. I had the 2 piece fish and chips. With an extra 2 oz of sauce, which goes perfect with the fish and or the fries. Good job Pete's fish and chips. Mesa Dr and Main Street in Mesa AZ. Kudos to the smiling staff too.
Pete's is very very tasty! The prices are great! The wait isn't bad even when they're packed, usually, they are always packed but yes, great food! Great prices and great service! Keep it up!

A family owned and operated establishment that has been present in the Valley for many decades. I am not normally a fan of seafood having grown up on the landlocked Canadian prarie( but Pete's is an exception. Quite reasonably priced and always delicious. You must pay with cash as they do not accept debit or credit cards but well worth it.
First time here and we found Waldos to be the best BBQ in town! The atmosphere is great! Comfortable patio, great service, great Happy hour, and live music! We will be coming back for sure!

My wife and I went here for the first time last night. They had live band playing - who was REALLY good. Added an awesome touch to the experience. 

The food was delicious. The staff friendly.

We got seated right away on a Saturday evening. Indoor and outdoor seating available.

The food was delivered quickly and exactly as we ordered it.

We will be back!

I normally go to their location in mesa but figured I would try this location since its on my way home. I ordered take out and they didnt give me all of my items. When i called in they were more than happy to fix it, but it still took longer than i cared to spend on a week night. The food was still good and everyone was friendly. I plan on giving them another chance.

Love Waldo's.. been enjoying their BBQ since the 90's So happy they expanded to Gilbert. Both locations have great staff, service and food.. I have never had a sub par meal or service. Always on point. See you again soon.
Had lunch with. 3 friends I haven't seen for over 50 years. Food and services were good .

We've lived in the East Valley for many years and it's hard to see them go. However I think it's time. We've had dinner there a few times over the years with the last time in May for my Birthday. The show was very different from the vibrant energetic show it used to be and the food was just so so. I wish them all the luck in the world.

Went on my birthday last week. I kind of feel bad leaving a negative review since they are closing down but you can certainly see why. The place wasn't even halfway full. It was dirty & depressing. When they called up people to sing Happy Birthday to themselves I opted not to go on stage. Although I think it's nice the people that went up received passes to come back I wouldn't have used. 

The food wasn't terrible, but for the money I'd rather go to Barleens. I saw someone mention it was all you can eat. We went through the line once & when I tried to go back in to grab some wet wipes they had already cleared out all the food so maybe with it closing they aren't doing that anymore? The entertainment was very outdated & the mom's singing voice is sadly not what it once was. Not trying to be rude, but if you are paying for entertainment & someone just cannot sing anymore they should not be lead vocals on a song. 

We ended up leaving after 3 songs to salvage the rest of the night elsewhere. I wish their family the best as they close down their business & really hope their daughter continues on with her singing career, she was why I gave the place any stars.

Fantastic food and excellent entertainment! Loved everything about the evening, and I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was an all you can eat dinner so I was able to go back for seconds in some of the juiciest chicken I’ve ever had! Sad to hear that the owners are retiring at the end of thanksgiving weekend. I’d highly recommend hitting it up before they do! I will be back again!

My family went to Rockin' R Ranch a few times when I was growing up. We ate dinner, watched the show and gunfight, panned for gold and roamed through stores. We loved every bit of it and since I associate this place with my childhood (we're the same age), I was saddened to find this place would be closing in November. Luckily I'll be back in town soon so I can introduce this place to my family before it closes.

Best of the West eats and entertainment all in one shop. The R.R. has the look and feel of an old west town and the Ghost Rider. If you book wisely you may also get free, 3 Shows from the Arizona Gunfighters, Historical Gunfighter showmen and woman.
